page.title: 02CHURCHES SOUTH OF SALISBURY
page.content: The Victorian stone/flint{'All {Saints'(C of E) Church ,Harnham}has a small bell tower & large graveyard. Rev. Canon Townsend conducts 2 or 3 services each Sunday. Harnham has about 7000 people,out of that morning congregation is 60,& evening 12. Activities include choirs & Womens Union. The brick{Harnham Free holds {2}Sunday services , Sunday School , Covenanters , & Bible studies. The stone/flint churches of the{Virgin {Mary (C of E)}Odstock and the 150 year old{St.Andrews (C of E) Nunton,}both have 3_belled square towers,and graveyards.Vicar Robert Honnington's congregation is 45.The executed gipsy Josuha Scamp is buried at Odstock.Also chapel at Odstock Hospital.The stone/flint 800 year old Virgin Mary's church has a square,single-belled tower and small graveyard.
